page.title: 18GOVERNMENT- TOWN DEVELOPMENT
page.content: The Northleach Town Council has put forward a draft plan for the development of Northleach, their main aims being to encourage expansion in the number of homes, shops and small businesses in order to attract fresh young faces to the town. Their plan is in three phases. The first including general improvements such as widening "Forty Road", dredging the Leach and campaigning for better policing. Northleach residents are also very involved in the battle for the retention of Westwood's Grammar School. The second aim is to increase light industry based on the Coalyard Farm development. The third phase is in improving the Tourist facilities- including new parking areas and the introduction of a special picnic/recreation area alongside the river.
